summary: I'm happy that the Marvel fandom doesn't act like the Star Wars fandom. I'm sure we've done some annoying stuff but, as far as I...
body: I’m happy that the Marvel fandom doesn’t act like the Star Wars fandom. I’m sure we’ve done some annoying stuff but, as far as I know, we haven’t caused any actors to leave social media.

blog.name: markbrooksart
blog.title: Mark Brooks
blog.description:
I'm a comic artist mostly for Marvel Comics but do/have done work for DC Comics, Darkhorse Comics, Warner Brothers, Disney, Lucas Film, and Hasbro from time to time.

2014 Inkpot award winner from San Diego Comic Con International. Father to Jack, husband to Lisa and feeding/poop slave to Gingerbread and Lulu.

I like to think I'm a swell guy but your mileage may vary.

Too Old For This Shit. Gen X. 40-something.
Demisexual (Autochorissexual), Panromantic, Genderqueer MBTI: INFP-T (Mediator)

Find me Around: 3DS Friends: 4699-6044-1915 Minecraft IGN: Banesidhe Flight Rising: Banesidhe #81628 Banesidhe @Chicken Smoothie Battlenet: Banesidhe#1691

About:A collector of geekery and whimsy, this tumblr is a mish-mash of BJD, Fandom, Craftiness, and Art appreciation. Currently obsessed with all things MCU. Current Ships: Stucky, Stony, Steam, Winterhawk, Winterwidow, Barbershop Quartet, and others.

I don't engage in ship-hating, or much fandom wank, but I do pass out popcorn and watch.

I try to tag efficiently, especially for spoilers, polite requests will get things changed.

White-Privileged and trying to do better, please feel free to educate and inform me if I do otherwise.

summary: ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ Once Wanda was afraid of Kylo. I was afraid to speak, I was afraid to come up, I was afraid to breathe ... Everyone said:...
caption:
ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ Once Wanda was afraid of Kylo. I was afraid to speak, I was afraid to come up, I was afraid to breathe … Everyone said: “He is a monster!”, But in her heart she knew that he was different, that deep in his heart he was fighting for the Light.
ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ He saw in her the perfect weapon. If it is properly directed, then everything is in trouble. Kylo trusted her and for good reason, Wanda never failed him. Thanks to Wanda’s abilities, all operations were successful.
ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ Wanda was used to the cruelty of Wren and became more condescending to this attitude. She approached him, because she wants to help determine the party, but Kailo does not know about it. He is often tormented by nightmares, but at these moments near Wanda.

ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ ㅤ N o w ㅤ s h e’s ㅤ a l w a y s ㅤ a r o u n d .

summary: Michelle Pfeiffer's heroine is finally revealed in new 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' posters
title: Michelle Pfeiffer's heroine is finally revealed in new 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' posters
body:
Avengers: Infinity War didn’t feature the Marvel Cinematic Universe’s most diminutive members, but in the lead-up to Ant-Man and the Wasp, we’ve gotten plenty of juicy reveals of the tiny heroes in action. Not only have we seen Paul Rudd cracking wise (and growing to enormous size as Giant Man), but we’ve also been blessed with looks at Rudd’s partner-in-crime-fighting Evangeline Lilly as the Wasp, their Quantum Realm adversary Ghost (Hannah John-Kamen), and also a seriously enormous (and deadly) Hello Kitty Pez dispenser. But it’s only today that we’ve finally received our first glimpse of the wife of Michael Douglas’s Hank Pym, who served as Earth’s first Wasp: Michelle Pfeiffer.

Among the new character posters released today for Ant-Man and the Wasp — most of which can be seen below — none is more exciting than the one for Pfeiffer’s Janet van Dyne, who was lost to Douglas’s Pym (himself the original Ant-Man) during a past mission into the Quantum Realm. How van Dyne will return to our world and reunite with both her husband and daughter (Lilly’s Hope van Dyne) remains unknown as of yet. However, the above image of her wearing a size-altering outfit makes it clear that Pfeiffer won’t just be standing around during Marvel’s latest — she’ll also be suiting up for action. The only question now is, will Douglas join her and, in the process, turn the proceedings into an all-out family affair?

With only two months to go, such questions will be answered soon enough — as well as, hopefully, a few lingering queries we have about the post-Infinity War fates of the Avengers. Co-starring Michael Peña, Walton Goggins, Bobby Cannavale, Judy Greer, Tip “T.I.” Harris, and Laurence Fishburne, Ant-Man and the Wasp lands in theaters on July 6.

Read more from Yahoo Entertainment:

  • ‘Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse’ trailer presents Spidey like you’ve never seen him before
  • ‘Bumblebee’ trailer goes old-school, takes Transformers back to the ’80s
  • The secret, scandalous life of Disney princesses revealed in new ‘Wreck-It Ralph 2’ trailer

Not only have we seen Paul Rudd cracking wise (and growing to enormous size as Giant Man), but we’ve also been blessed with looks at Rudd’s partner-in-crime-fighting Evangeline Lilly as the Wasp, their Quantum Realm adversary Ghost (Hannah John-Kamen), and also a seriously enormous (and deadly) Hello Kitty Pez dispenser. Among the new character posters released today for Ant-Man and the Wasp — most of which can be seen below — none is more exciting than the one for Pfeiffer’s Janet van Dyne, who was lost to Douglas’s Pym (himself the original Ant-Man) during a past mission into the Quantum Realm. title: Tony and Pepper
body:
